00042 typedef unsigned _int64 tommy_uint64_t; 
00043 typedef size_t tommy_uintptr_t;

00298 /******************************************************************************/
00299 /* bit hacks */
00300 
00301 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__cplusplus)
00302 #include <intrin.h>
00303 #pragma intrinsic(_BitScanReverse)
00304 #pragma intrinsic(_BitScanForward)
00305 #endif
00306 
00311 #define TOMMY_ILOG2(value) ((value) == 256 ? 8 : (value) == 128 ? 7 : (value) == 64 ? 6 : (value) == 32 ? 5 : (value) == 16 ? 4 : (value) == 8 ? 3 : (value) == 4 ? 2 : (value) == 2 ? 1 : 0)
00312 
00331 tommy_inline tommy_uint_t tommy_ilog2_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00332 {
00333 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00334         unsigned long count;
00335         _BitScanReverse(&count, value);
00336         return count;
00337 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00338         /*
00339          * GCC implements __builtin_clz(x) as "__builtin_clz(x) = bsr(x) ^ 31"
00340          *
00341          * Where "x ^ 31 = 31 - x", but gcc does not optimize "31 - __builtin_clz(x)" to bsr(x),
00342          * but generates 31 - (bsr(x) xor 31).
00343          *
00344          * So we write "__builtin_clz(x) ^ 31" instead of "31 - __builtin_clz(x)",
00345          * to allow the double xor to be optimized out.
00346          */
00347         return __builtin_clz(value) ^ 31;
00348 #else
00349         /* Find the log base 2 of an N-bit integer in O(lg(N)) operations with multiply and lookup */
00350         /* from http://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html */
00351         static unsigned char TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_ILOG2[32] = {
00352                 0, 9, 1, 10, 13, 21, 2, 29, 11, 14, 16, 18, 22, 25, 3, 30,
00353                 8, 12, 20, 28, 15, 17, 24, 7, 19, 27, 23, 6, 26, 5, 4, 31
00354         };
00355 
00356         value |= value >> 1;
00357         value |= value >> 2;
00358         value |= value >> 4;
00359         value |= value >> 8;
00360         value |= value >> 16;
00361 
00362         return TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_ILOG2[(tommy_uint32_t)(value * 0x07C4ACDDU) >> 27];
00363 #endif
00364 }
00365 
00374 tommy_inline tommy_uint_t tommy_ctz_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00375 {
00376 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00377         unsigned long count;
00378         _BitScanForward(&count, value);
00379         return count;
00380 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00381         return __builtin_ctz(value);
00382 #else
00383         /* Count the consecutive zero bits (trailing) on the right with multiply and lookup */
00384         /* from http://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html */
00385         static const unsigned char TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_CTZ[32] = {
00386                 0, 1, 28, 2, 29, 14, 24, 3, 30, 22, 20, 15, 25, 17, 4, 8,
00387                 31, 27, 13, 23, 21, 19, 16, 7, 26, 12, 18, 6, 11, 5, 10, 9
00388         };
00389 
00390         return TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_CTZ[(tommy_uint32_t)(((value & - value) * 0x077CB531U)) >> 27];
00391 #endif
00392 }
00393 
00399 tommy_inline tommy_uint32_t tommy_roundup_pow2_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00400 {
00401         /* Round up to the next highest power of 2 */
00402         /* from http://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html */
00403 
00404         --value;
00405         value |= value >> 1;
00406         value |= value >> 2;
00407         value |= value >> 4;
00408         value |= value >> 8;
00409         value |= value >> 16;
00410         ++value;
00411 
00412         return value;
00413 }
00414 
00419 tommy_inline int tommy_haszero_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00420 {
00421         return ((value - 0x01010101) & ~value & 0x80808080) != 0;
00422 }
00423 #endif
